description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Hypervisor-Protected Code Integrity (HVCI) security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-21305):

1. Identify the relevant Windows build number for your installation from the build numbers listed below:
   - Windows 11 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.17763.5329, 10.0.20348.2227, 10.0.25398.643
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22631.3007
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22621.3007
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22000.2713
   - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.17763.5329
   - Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems: 10.0.17763.5329, 10.0.20348.2227
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.19045.3930
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.19044.3930

2. Apply the appropriate KB articles to your systems based on the build number:
   - For Windows 11: KB5034121, KB5034123, KB5034129
   - For Windows 10: KB5034122, KB5034127, KB5034129

3. Download the updates via the official Microsoft catalog:
   - Windows 11 for x64-based Systems: [KB5034123](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034123), [KB5034121](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034121), [KB5034129](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034129)
   - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: [KB5034122](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034122), [KB5034127](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034127)

**Details**:
- Ensure your system is backed up before proceeding with the updates.
- Verify that HVCI is activated post-installation for continued protection against security threats.

**Preconditions**:
- This action requires administrative privileges. Please ensure to backup your data before proceeding.
